summary:
The Kingdom of Bohemia was a country in Central Europe, which is now part of the Czech Republic. It was an important kingdom in the Holy Roman Empire, and its kings were powerful, sometimes becoming Holy Roman Emperors. The kingdom was ruled by different dynasties over the centuries.

Bohemia's capital, Prague, was a major city and sometimes the seat of the Holy Roman Empire. The Czech language was widely used, but German also became important, especially after German immigration in the 13th century. After World War I, Bohemia joined with Slovakia to form Czechoslovakia.
title: Kingdom of Bohemia
